alert.note: Alert for Clay; Knott; Leslie; Owsley; Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 28 at 3:47AM EDT until July 28 at 6:30AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY FOR NORTHERN PERRY AND LESLIE COUNTIES, AND NORTHEAST CLAY COUNTY... The National Weather Service in Jackson has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Clay County in southeastern Kentucky... Southwestern Knott County in southeastern Kentucky... Northern Leslie County in southeastern Kentucky... Southeastern Owsley County in southeastern Kentucky... Perry County in southeastern Kentucky... * Until 630 AM EDT. * At 347 AM EDT, trained weather spotters reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. This is a FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY for northern Perry and Leslie counties, and northeast Clay county. This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW! HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW! Life threatening flash flooding of low water crossings, small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hazard, Vicco, Buckhorn, Avawam, Toulouse, Krypton, Mosley Bend, Confluence, Lamont, Dryhill, Wooton, Chavies, Frew, Kaliopi, Dice, Gays Creek, Shoal, Diablock, Bulan and Buckhorn Lake S.P. Multiple swift water rescues have been reported in Perry county. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CATASTROPHIC
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now! This is an extremely dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
